page.title: 12 CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Mrs Betteridge has lived in Sedgeberrow for 50 years and Mr Betteridge has lived here for 62 years. Mr Betteridge was a thatcher working for someone for 30 shillings a week. He started working on his own in 1936 and some of his thatched houses can still be seen. There were not many houses when Mr Betteridge came, but there were 2 shops. In 1940 the mill was working and there was a bakery. Not many people had cars but there was a regular bus service into Evesham. Bread was delivered by a person with a pony and cart and other goods were also brought round to the houses. Most villagers worked on the land and several had their own smallholdings.
